Why it makes sense: The contract ID encodes the funding date (e.g., sequential IDs).
Collection usually opens shortly after funding; the two timestamps move together.
Same reason as above – ID carries a temporal component.
The most recent payment tends to occur after the case is opened, and later open dates push the last‑payment date forward.
Again a by‑product of the temporal ordering embedded in the ID.
Loans funded later have later payment histories.
